iti42:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti42:2.1: “These two bright things, mendicants, protect the world.
iti42:2.4: If these two bright things did not protect the world, there would be no recognition of the status of mother, aunts, or wives and partners of teachers and respected people.
iti42:2.5: The world would become promiscuous, like goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, and dogs and jackals.
iti42:2.6: But because the two bright things protect the world, there is recognition of the status of mother, aunts, and wives and partners of teachers and respected people.”
